newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thailand's Bangchak tenders to buy April crude.
newsitem.headline: Thailand's Bangchak tenders to buy April crude.

text.p: Thailand's Bangchak Petroleum Plc has tendered to buy 500,000 barrels of Middle East crude and 600,000 barrels of light sweet Far East crude for April, traders said on Friday.
The tender closes February 25 and offers should be valid until February 26.
The refiner traditionally buys Oman or a similar grade from the Middle East. In recent tenders it has shown an appetite for Iranian heavy crude.
It often awards Tapis crude oil from regional offers.

In its March tender it awarded one cargo of Oman crude oil from a Japanese trader at MPM +10 cents. In negotiations following the tender it also acquired a Tapis cargo from a trader, market sources said.
